summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein in the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) Special Housing Unit (SHU). It chronicles his activities on August 9, 2019, including a court appearance and attorney visits, and the subsequent discovery of him unresponsive in his cell on the morning of August 10, leading to resuscitation attempts, transport to the hospital, and official declaration of death. It also details the institutional notifications and investigative responses that followed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the subject of the timeline. He was found unresponsive in his cell in the SHU on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead at the hospital.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case, who was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with the press release.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Arrived at the correctional institution at 7:30 am on August 10, 2019, following the medical emergency involving inmate Epstein.

persons.name: SIS Lt
persons.context: Notified at 7:36 am and arrived at the institution at 8:10 am on August 10, 2019. Reported to the SHU to conduct interviews with inmates on the tier.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 8:00 am on August 10, 2019, following the incident.

persons.name: CMC
persons.context: Notified at 8:10 am, arrived at the institution at 9:15 am, and later traveled to Beekman Hospital with the IDO to secure Epstein's fingerprints, photographs, and clothing. Returned to the institution at 10:15 am.

persons.name: SCSS
persons.context: Notified at 8:10 am and arrived at the institution at 9:50 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: IDO
persons.context: Reported providing a social call to inmate Epstein at 7:00 pm on August 9, 2019, noting he was in 'good spirits.' Later traveled to Beekman Hospital with the CMC on August 10.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: Reported the official time of death of Jeffrey Epstein as 7:20 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Brother
persons.context: Epstein's brother, who was notified of his death by the Case Management Coordinator at 11:00 am on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: The IDO reported providing a social call to inmate Epstein on the evening before his death, noting he was in 'good spirits.'
Judge Berman was the presiding judge in Epstein's case and was officially notified of his death.
The CMC and IDO traveled together to Beekman Hospital to secure evidence (fingerprints, photographs, clothing) from Epstein's body.
The SIS Lt was tasked with investigating the incident and conducting interviews with inmates on Epstein's tier following his death.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day Activities
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein departs for court in the morning, spends the day in attorney conferences, returns to the SHU in the evening, and receives a social call from an IDO who reports he is in 'good spirits.'

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated in the SHU. Staff find inmate Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated immediately.

events.title: Medical Response and Transport
events.description: Medical staff and EMS respond, continuing CPR, applying an AED, intubating Epstein, and administering medication. He is transported to Beekman Hospital at 7:10 am.

events.title: Official Time of Death
events.description: An ER physician reports the official time of death as 7:20 am. Multiple agencies including the FBI, AUSA, and OIG are notified throughout the morning.

events.title: Institutional and External Notifications
events.description: The Warden, SIS, CMC, SCSS, FBI, AUSA, Judge Berman, and Epstein's brother are all notified. A press release is issued. The body is released to the Medical Examiner for autopsy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) / The Institution (implied location of SHU)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
On the evening prior (August 9, 2019), an Inmate Discipline Officer (IDO) reported Epstein was in 'good spirits' during a social call.
Despite extensive resuscitation efforts including CPR, AED, intubation, and epinephrine, Epstein was pronounced dead by an ER physician at 7:20 am on August 10.
Multiple investigative bodies were notified rapidly, including the FBI (8:34 am), the U.S. Attorney's Office (9:00 am), and the Office of the Inspector General (3:10 pm).
Epstein's body was released to the Medical Examiner for an autopsy at 12:15 pm on August 10, 2019.
